name: Oven-Roasted Boerewors with Creamy Pap and Tomato-Onion Relish
description: South African-style boerewors roasted in the oven, served with quick creamy pap and a warm tomato-onion relish, plus roasted broccoli on the side. Mild, simple, and weeknight-fast.
prep_steps: Line a baking tray with foil; lightly oil it.
Coil the boerewors onto the tray (secure with a skewer if needed).
Set a medium pot with 3 cups boiling water for pap.
Open the tomato and onion mix.
cook_steps: Roast the boerewors for 20–25 minutes, turning once halfway, until browned and cooked through.
Toss broccoli with oil, salt, and garlic powder on a second tray; roast for 15–18 minutes until tender and lightly charred.
For pap: whisk maize meal into the boiling salted water, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook 10–12 minutes, stirring once or twice until thick. Stir in butter to finish.
Warm the tomato and onion mix in a small saucepan over medium heat for 5–7 minutes; season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Slice the boerewors. Plate pap, top with tomato-onion relish, add sliced boerewors and roasted broccoli. Serve chakalaka on the side for those who want it.
